channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Intelligence
channel.description: Latest threat intelligence threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: "Battering RAM": $50 Hardware Attack Cracks Intel and AMD Secure CPU Enclaves
item.description:
At the Black Hat Europe 2025 conference, researchers from KU Leuven University demonstrated "Battering RAM," a novel hardware attack that completely undermines modern confidential computing technologies. Using a custom-built DDR4 interposer costing just $50, the attack can bypass the memory encrypti...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Goes Global, Targeting New Regions and Industries with Weaker Defenses
item.description:
Ransomware is becoming a more globalized and unpredictable threat, according to the H2 2025 Global Threat Briefing from cyber analytics firm CyberCube. The report warns that ransomware groups are actively expanding into new geographic regions and industry sectors that have historically seen fewer at...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

item.title: Hackers Use Animated Lures and Fake Legal Warnings to Spread Malware
item.description:
HP's latest Threat Insights Report reveals a significant evolution in social engineering tactics, with cybercriminals using highly convincing lures such as professional animations and fake legal warnings to trick users into downloading malware. The report highlights a campaign impersonating the Colo...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: OPSEC Fail: North Korean Spy 'Trevor Greer' Exposed by Own Infostealer Infection
item.description:
In a major operational security (OPSEC) failure, a North Korean state-sponsored hacker was unmasked after accidentally infecting their own machine with commodity infostealer malware like LummaC2. The leaked logs, analyzed by Flashpoint and Hudson Rock, exposed the digital life of an operative using ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: AI Threat Hunting Exposes 'GhostPenguin,' a Linux Backdoor Undetected for Months
item.description:
Researchers at Trend Micro have discovered "GhostPenguin," a sophisticated, multi-threaded Linux backdoor written in C++. The malware remained completely undetected on VirusTotal for over four months after its initial submission. It was ultimately found using an AI-driven automated threat hunting pi...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: White House Sets 2025 Deadline for Post-Quantum Crypto Readiness
item.description:
The White House has issued a new Executive Order to accelerate the U.S. federal government's transition to post-quantum cryptography (PQC). The order sets a critical deadline of December 1, 2025, for several key initiatives. It directs CISA and the NSA to create and maintain a list of commercially a...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Malicious Rust Package 'evm-units' Targets Web3 Developers
item.description:
A malicious software package named 'evm-units' has been discovered and removed from Rust's official crates.io registry. The package, downloaded over 7,200 times, targeted Web3 developers by impersonating a legitimate utility for the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). While appearing functional, the cra...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran Bans Officials From Using All Internet-Connected Devices Over Espionage Fears
item.description:
In a drastic measure to combat espionage, Iran's Cybersecurity Command has banned all government officials and their security staff from using any device connected to public communication networks. The directive, reported on December 5, 2025, includes smartphones, laptops, and smartwatches. The move...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Ransomware Payments Exceed $2.1 Billion Since 2022, FinCEN Reports
item.description:
A new Financial Trend Analysis from the U.S. Treasury's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN), released December 4, 2025, reveals that financial institutions reported over $2.1 billion in ransomware-related payments between January 2022 and December 2024. The data, derived from Bank Secrecy ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: CISA KEV Alert: Actively Exploited ScadaBR Flaw Puts Industrial Control Systems at Risk
item.description:
CISA has added CVE-2021-26828, a high-severity vulnerability in the OpenPLC ScadaBR industrial control system (ICS) software, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog as of December 3, 2025. The flaw, with a CVSS score of 8.7, is an unrestricted file upload vulnerability that allows an a...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence
